Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Anoplin (Leu-rich; natural AMPs; insects, arthropods, invertebrates, animals; XXA; SAR; derivatives)
Sequence Information.Crucial residues: C-terminal NH2, hydrophobic Leu and Ile, and peptide length (Ifrah D et al 2005 J Pept Sci 11: 113-121)

Literature Information.Literature: It is helical in SDS or TFE based on CD. 3D structure of anoplin in complex with DPC micelle is determined by 2D NMR (NMR_DPC)(Uggerh√∏j LE et al., 2014).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structure on a micelleherein the PDB. The peptide appears to present ion channel-like activity (Dos Santos Cabrera MP et al 2008 J Pept Sci 14: 661-9). However, C-terminal amidation is not important for antifungal activity (BBA 2014). In the above 2014 NMR study, the structure-activity relationship (SAR) was explored, including the determination of the 3D structures of several mutants (R5W;R5K, T8W; andR5F, T8W).Surface immobilized peptide: Surface immobilization to chitosan polymers enahnced peptide activity and reduced peptide toxicity (Sahariah et al., 2015). Updated 2/2014; structure 12/2014; Jan2018.
Literature Information.Author: Konno K, Hisada M, Fontana R, Lorenzi CC, Naoki H, Itagaki Y, Miwa A, Kawai N, Nakata Y, Yasuhara T, Ruggiero Neto J, de Azevedo WF Jr, Palma MS, Nakajima T.2001
Literature Information.Title: Anoplin, a novel antimicrobial peptide from the venom of the solitary wasp Anoplius samariensis.
